newsitem.title: UK: BTR shares advance on talk of break-up.
newsitem.headline: BTR shares advance on talk of break-up.

text.p: Buyers for BTR shares kept coming on Monday, pushing the stock 6-1/2p higher to 221-1/2p following through strong gains seen last week.
Volume was more than four million shares by 1035 GMT.

The Sunday Times newspaper quoted an analyst as saying a break-up would create about seven billion stg of value from the demerged or disposed businesses, and with four billion of yearly sales and profits of about 600 million, BTR would be worth more than five billion.
"We're seeing more of the same buyers we saw last week, a lot of interest from the U.S. and it's being helped by the weekend press comment about a break-up," said a dealer.
A report in the Daily Mail newspaper on June 26 saying a break-up of the conglomerate could yield about three billion stg also sent the price higher. The stock was trading around 200p.
The stock hit a year's low on June 10 at 180p after a profit-warning in May.
